implementation_steps.task_description: Create .gitignore file to exclude node_modules, build artifacts, .env files, and OS-specific files. Include entries: node_modules/, build/, .DS_Store, .env, npm-debug.log. This ensures clean version control and will be used by all developers before committing.

Initialize package.json with project metadata: name 'simple-todo-app', version '1.0.0', description, scripts (start, build, test), and dependencies: react, react-dom, and devDependencies: @babel/core, @babel/preset-react, webpack, webpack-cli, webpack-dev-server, css-loader, style-loader, html-webpack-plugin. This file is the foundation for installing packages and building the app.

Create root HTML file. Include a
placeholder. Add a Simple Todo App. Link to bundled JS via . This file is loaded by the browser and will host the React root rendered by src/index.js.

Implement entry point. Import React, ReactDOM, and App component. Use ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root')).render(<React.StrictMode><App /></React.StrictMode>); Export nothing. This file boots the React tree and must be referenced in webpack entry.

Create utility module with two named exports:
- `saveTasks(tasks: Array<Task>)`: serializes tasks to JSON and stores under key 'todoTasks' in localStorage.
- `loadTasks(): Array<Task>`: reads key 'todoTasks', parses JSON, returns array or empty array if missing.
Define a TypeScript‑like JSDoc `@typedef {Object} Task` with fields `id:string`, `title:string`, `description?:string`, `completed:boolean`. This module will be imported by App.js for persistence.

Write responsive CSS for the app. Define root variables for colors, fonts. Style body, .app-container (max-width, margin auto, padding). Add media queries for mobile (max-width: 600px) to adjust layout. Include classes used by components: .task-input, .task-item, .task-list, .filter-bar, .completed (text-decoration line-through, opacity). Ensure the stylesheet is imported in App.js.

Implement functional component `TaskInput({ onAdd })`.
- Internal state: title (string), description (string).
- Render a form with input for title (required) and textarea for description (optional), and a submit button.
- On submit, prevent default, generate a unique id (`Date.now().toString()`), create task object matching `Task` typedef, call `onAdd(task)`, then clear fields.
- Export default TaskInput.
- Import React and PropTypes. This component will be used in App.js to add new tasks.

Implement functional component `TaskItem({ task, onToggle, onEdit, onDelete })`.
- Props: `task` object (id, title, description, completed), callbacks for toggle completion, edit, delete.
- Render a container showing a checkbox (checked based on `task.completed`) that calls `onToggle(task.id)` when changed.
- Display title and description; if `task.completed` apply CSS class `completed`.
- Provide Edit button that toggles an inline edit mode (local state `isEditing`). In edit mode, show inputs pre‑filled with current title/description and Save/Cancel buttons. Save calls `onEdit(updatedTask)`.
- Delete button calls `onDelete(task.id)`.
- Export default TaskItem.
- Import React, useState, PropTypes. This component will be rendered by TaskList.

Implement functional component `TaskList({ tasks, filter, onToggle, onEdit, onDelete })`.
- Props: `tasks` array, `filter` string ('all'|'active'|'completed'), and callbacks passed through to TaskItem.
- Compute `filteredTasks` based on filter: all → tasks, active → !completed, completed → completed.
- Map `filteredTasks` to `<TaskItem key={task.id} task={task} onToggle={onToggle} onEdit={onEdit} onDelete={onDelete} />`.
- Export default TaskList.
- Import React and TaskItem. This component will be used in App.js to display the list.

Implement functional component `FilterBar({ currentFilter, onChange })`.
- Props: `currentFilter` string, `onChange(filter)` callback.
- Render three button elements: All, Active, Completed. Highlight the active filter (e.g., class `active`). Clicking a button calls `onChange('all'|'active'|'completed')`.
- Export default FilterBar.
- Import React, PropTypes. This component will be placed in App.js to let the user switch filters.

Implement main application component.
- Import React, useState, useEffect, and all child components plus `saveTasks`/`loadTasks`.
- Define state: `tasks` (array of Task), `filter` (string default 'all').
- On mount (`useEffect` with empty deps), load tasks via `loadTasks()` and set state.
- Whenever `tasks` changes, persist via `saveTasks(tasks)` (`useEffect` dependent on tasks).
- Handlers:
  * `handleAdd(task)` → setTasks(prev => [...prev, task]).
  * `handleToggle(id)` → map tasks toggling `completed` flag for matching id.
  * `handleEdit(updatedTask)` → map tasks replacing the matching id.
  * `handleDelete(id)` → filter out task.
  * `handleFilterChange(newFilter)` → setFilter(newFilter).
- Render layout: a div with class `app-container` containing `<TaskInput onAdd={handleAdd} />`, `<FilterBar currentFilter={filter} onChange={handleFilterChange} />`, and `<TaskList tasks={tasks} filter={filter} onToggle={handleToggle} onEdit={handleEdit} onDelete={handleDelete} />`.
- Import './styles/App.css' for styling.
- Export default App.
- This component ties together all other components and persistence utilities.

Write documentation covering:
- Project overview and features list.
- Prerequisites (Node.js, npm).
- Installation steps (`npm install`).
- Development script (`npm start`).
- Build script (`npm run build`).
- Description of folder structure and where each component resides.
- How localStorage persistence works.
- Contribution guidelines.
- License information.
This file provides onboarding for developers and users.

plan.name: SimpleTodoApp
plan.description: A simple web-based to-do list application that allows users to add, edit, delete, and mark tasks as completed. The app stores tasks in the browser's local storage so that data persists across sessions without a backend.
features: User can create a new task with a title and optional description
User can mark a task as completed/uncompleted
User can edit an existing task
Filter view to show All, Active, or Completed tasks
Responsive design for desktop and mobile

Component representing a single task with edit, complete, and delete controls
Component that renders a list of TaskItem components based on current filter
Component providing filter buttons (All, Active, Completed)
Utility functions for saving and loading tasks from localStorage
Styling for the application, ensuring responsive layout
Project metadata and dependencies (React, ReactDOM, etc.)
